snippet.textDisplay: What is absolutely great about the comment section,is the fact that the majority is acknowledging her incompetence rather than making it a race issue. If we debated like this on all matters,I think things might turn around for the good.. All hope is not lost.
snippet.textOriginal: What is absolutely great about the comment section,is the fact that the majority is acknowledging her incompetence rather than making it a race issue. If we debated like this on all matters,I think things might turn around for the good.. All hope is not lost.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree. It's good to see people focusing on the main issue for once, even though it is a question of race to some extent. There were almost certainly candidates of other races (Indian, white) who are more qualified for the job but were not chosen because of their race. That being said, there are obviously black candidates who are much more competent. Political connections probably played a bigger role than race in this case, but you can't ignore either of them.
